chapters.name: What Is Computer Science?
topics: What is computer science and how is it different from programming?
What fundamental questions does computer science address?
How did computer science develop as a discipline?
What are the major subfields of computer science?
Why is computer science considered both science and engineering?
What skills do computer scientists develop?

chapters.name: Algorithms and Problem Solving
topics: What is an algorithm and what makes one good or bad?
How do you measure algorithm efficiency using Big O notation?
What is the difference between linear, logarithmic, and exponential time?
What are classic algorithms for searching and sorting?
How do divide-and-conquer strategies solve complex problems?
Why do some problems have no efficient algorithms?

chapters.name: Data Structures
topics: What are data structures and why do they matter?
How do arrays, linked lists, and dynamic arrays differ?
What are stacks and queues and where are they used?
How do trees and graphs organize hierarchical and networked data?
What are hash tables and why are they so fast?
How do you choose the right data structure for a problem?

chapters.name: Programming Languages
topics: What is a programming language and how do they differ?
What is the difference between compiled and interpreted languages?
What are the major programming paradigms: procedural, object-oriented, functional?
Why do so many programming languages exist?
How do programming languages evolve over time?
What language should a beginner learn first?

chapters.name: Computer Architecture
topics: How do computers execute instructions at the hardware level?
What is the von Neumann architecture?
How do CPU, memory, and storage work together?
What is the memory hierarchy and why does it matter for performance?
How do modern CPUs achieve parallel execution?
What are the limits of current computer architecture?

chapters.name: Operating Systems
topics: What does an operating system do and why do we need one?
How do operating systems manage multiple running programs?
What is virtual memory and how does it work?
How do file systems organize data on storage devices?
What security features do operating systems provide?
What are the differences between Windows, macOS, Linux, and mobile OS?

chapters.name: Networks and the Internet
topics: How do computers communicate over networks?
What is the TCP/IP protocol stack and how does it work?
How does the internet route data packets around the world?
What is HTTP and how do web browsers and servers communicate?
How does DNS translate domain names to IP addresses?
What security threats exist on networks and how are they countered?

chapters.name: Databases
topics: What is a database and why do we use them?
What is SQL and how do you query relational databases?
What are the ACID properties and why do they matter for transactions?
What is the difference between relational and NoSQL databases?
How do databases handle millions of requests per second?
What is database normalization and when should you denormalize?

chapters.name: Theory of Computation
topics: What is computability and what can computers actually compute?
What is a Turing machine and why is it important?
What is the halting problem and why can't it be solved?
What is the P versus NP problem and why does it matter?
What problems are NP-complete and why are they hard?
What are the limits of what computers can do?

chapters.name: Software Engineering
topics: How do teams build large, complex software systems?
What is the software development lifecycle?
What are agile methods and how do they differ from waterfall?
How do version control systems like Git help collaboration?
What is testing and why is it essential for software quality?
What makes software maintainable and how do you reduce technical debt?
